Rose trusted Agnes and talked to her. She even let Agnes know she was trying to catch Joseph when he was stealing.
That makes it seem more certain that Agnes stole Rose's wallet.
I am sure it is Agnes who stole her wallet. She was the only person who sat closely to Rose. Like Rose said, she shouldn't have trusted strangers and talked to Agnes.
_user_ and Jordan, let's look at this next part of the story.
Rose was distracted by Agnes's appearance and words. So Rose did not realize Agnes stole her wallet and left.
_user_ and Jordan, welcome back!
_user_. Cristina. Hello again . What are we going to do today?

We are going to practice connecting the character descriptions and events to the plot. This is one way we can elaborate on the story - or understand information that the writer does not tell us directly.
Are there some questions we can ask to help us figure it out?
Yes. One is, does this description or event connect to the plot? Another is, how does this event or description connect to the plot?
I think we can do this!

Let's start by reading this story, Rose the Cop. Push the Click to Continue button at the bottom of the passage when you have finished reading. If you like, you can click the green Read Text button at the bottom of the screen and read along with the recording.
_user_ and Jordan, let's briefly wrap up what we learned from this activity.
Cristina, I think in the narrative stories, character descriptions and events are connected. The descriptions help you think about how the characters are likely to act in the plot of the story.
Jordan, yes. But sometimes, the characters don't act as you expect that they will. This can lead to a major event, like what happened with Rose.
Yeah! Her mistake makes the story interesting. For example, Rose doesn't like to talk to strangers, but she talked to Agnes.
And then Agnes stole her wallet! Do you see how the character descriptions and events help to form the plot?
Yes, The descriptions connect to the events. Then, the events form the plot.
Jordan, perfect. You both are on your way to mastering the elaborating strategy!
The first sentence is an example of an event that fits with Roses personality. She considers the risks involved before taking action.
But when she meets Agnes, Rose does not behave as usual. You would not think she would talk to Agnes. Although, I guess in the second sentence she is just letting Agnes talk to her.

Jordan, You're right. But Roses unusual behavior in the third sentence is what the author needed to move the plot forward. She takes a risk and tells Agnes who she is. Let's look at the following sentence to decide if it is a character description or an event.
_user_ and Jordan, let's see how this event connects to the descriptions of Roses character.
Agnes is the antagonist and Rose is the protagonist. They are the main characters who have a conflict.
oh yeah. Who could forget the conflict between Rose and Agnes?

It's a good one. In the following exercise, you will read the highlighted sentence from the passage. You will decide if it is a character description or an event. Then, you will select an orange or pink icon to drag and drop onto the highlighted sentence.
So, if the sentence is a character description, I would drag the orange character description icon on the sentence?
Yes. Rose is the police woman trying to catch a thief.
Cristina, If there is a protagonist, there should be an antagonist. Right?
Jordan that is Correct
In this story, there are really only two main characters. There is a protagonist and an antagonist.
Cristina, What do you mean by protagonist and antagonist?
The protagonist is the hero or character that we want to support. The antagonist is the villain or character that we root against.
Unfortunately, Rose realizes that she trusted the wrong person.
I guess we should never judge a person by their appearance.
Jordan, thats a good point. let's take a closer look at how this event connects to the plot.
Jordan, why would this description of Rose make her a good policewoman?
Rose is a cautious person. She can keep a secret.
Jordan, Both of those things would make her good at her job. Let's see how that affects the rest of the story
This event shows the reader that Rose is trying to do her job. She is watching Joseph, while pretending to read the newspaper.
ok. so Roses actions match her character description.
Jordan, That's true. Let's see how the next event that happens to Rose connects to the plot.

Question.text: _user_, look at the highlighted names in the passage. Who is the protagonist in this story?

Answer.name: CCCristina
Answer.text: The protagonist in this story is Rose. We can get a clue from the title, Rose the Cop. We empathize with Rose after reading this story.

Answer.name: ExplanationJordan
Answer.text: Rose's name is in the story a lot, so I knew she must be a main character. Since she is trying to stop the pickpocketer, she must be our hero, or the protagonist.

Answer.name: HintCristina
Answer.text: _user_, the protagonist is the character that the reader or audience wants to support.

Answer.name: HintJordan
Answer.text: Maybe the title of the story could give us some clues.

Answer.name: JordanAnswerIncor
Answer.text: I thought Diana would be the protagonist.

Answer.name: JordanAnswerCor
Answer.text: I think Rose might be the protagonist in this story.

Answer.name: ClickInstruction
Answer.text: _user_, please click the highlighted name that you think is the answer.

Question.text: _user_, who is the antagonist in this story?

Answer.name: CCCristina
Answer.text: The antagonist in the story is Agnes. She creates the conflict in the story.

Answer.name: ExplanationJordan
Answer.text: I see. Agnes provides conflict in the story, plus she is responsible for stealing the wallets!

Answer.name: HintCristina
Answer.text: _user_, the antagonist is the character who opposes the hero.

Answer.name: HintJordan
Answer.text: _user_, the name of the main characters are frequently repeated in the story. Besides Rose, whose name is repeated frequently?

Answer.name: JordanAnswerIncor
Answer.text: I don't know. Maybe, Joseph?

Answer.name: JordanAnswerCor
Answer.text: I pick Agnes. She could be the antagonist.

Answer.name: ClickInstruction
Answer.text: _user_, please click the highlighted name that you think is the answer.

Question.text: _user_, is this highlighted sentence a character description or an event?

Answer.name: CCCristina
Answer.text: This sentence describes Roses character. So it is a character description.

Answer.name: ExplanationJordan
Answer.text: This sentence tells us Rose was not a person who talks to strangers, so I guess it is not something that Rose is doing or something that is happening to Rose.

Answer.name: HintCristina
Answer.text: _user_, character descriptions tell us more about a character's personality, physical appearance, motives, and behaviors. Events are the actions that occur in a story.

Answer.name: HintJordan
Answer.text: _user_, is this sentence an action that occurs in this story or just a description of personality?

Answer.name: JordanAnswerIncor
Answer.text: I think it is an event.
Answer.speech: I think it is an event.

Answer.name: JordanAnswerCor
Answer.text: There is no action occurring in this sentence, it seems more like a description of Roses personality. So I think the correct answer is character description.

Answer.name: ClickInstruction
Answer.text: _user_, drag and drop the description or event icon on the highlighted sentence.

Question.text: _user_, we have a description of Rose's character that says Rose was not one to talk to strangers. Based on this description, which of the three highlighted actions seems most unlike Rose?

Answer.name: CCCristina
Answer.text: According to this character description, Rose was not a person who talked to strangers. However, in one of the events she tells Agnes that she is a police officer even though she is under cover. This event shouldn't have happened according to Roses character description.

Answer.name: ExplanationJordan
Answer.text: Yeah, these three events show Rose letting down her guard around Agnes. This event doesn't seem to agree with her character description.

Answer.name: HintCristina
Answer.text: _user_, we know from the description of Rose that she is naturally cautious about talking to strangers. It seems like one of the highlighted events below should not have happened based on that information. Which one do you think it is?

Answer.name: HintJordan
Answer.text: _user_, Let's see. Which event doesn't agree with Rose's character description?

Answer.name: JordanAnswerIncor
Answer.text: I would like to choose the first one. Rose paused for a minute and considered the potential risk.

Answer.name: JordanAnswerCor
Answer.text: I think I will choose the part where Rose whispers that she is a police officer.

Answer.name: ClickInstruction
Answer.text: _user_, please click the correct answer.

Question.text: _user_, is this a character description or an event?

Answer.name: CCCristina
Answer.text: This sentence describes what Rose is doing, so it is an event.

Answer.name: ExplanationJordan
Answer.text: Rose participates in three actions according to the this sentence, she is seated, sipping and watching. So I see why it is an event.

Answer.name: HintCristina
Answer.text: _user_, events usually refer to something that occurs in a certain situation. Descriptions help us understand what a character or situation is like.

Answer.name: HintJordan
Answer.text: _user_, what do you think this sentence tells us about Rose. I am not sure.

Answer.name: JordanAnswerIncor
Answer.text: The correct answer is character description.

Answer.name: JordanAnswerCor
Answer.text: The correct answer is event, because this sentence describes something that is happening in the story.

Answer.name: ClickInstruction
Answer.text: Drag and drop the description or event icon on the highlighted sentence.

Question.text: _user_, think about the event above in which Rose is comfortably seated and sipping coffee. Which highlighted character description below is connected to the event above?

Answer.name: CCCristina
Answer.text: The correct answer is she was always aware of her surroundings when she walked down the street and cautious about every possible wolf that crossed her path. This description makes us think that Rose would be cautious about her surroundings and would watch Joseph.

Answer.name: ExplanationJordan
Answer.text: Yes, Rose watched Joseph carefully and cautiously. She pretended to read her paper to hide what she was doing.

Answer.name: HintCristina
Answer.text: _user_, one description emphasizes that Rose is always aware of her surroundings. The other description lets us know that she is skilled at knowing when people are telling the truth.

Answer.name: HintJordan
Answer.text: _user_, which of these two descriptions connects to an event where she would watch Joseph carefully?

Answer.name: JordanAnswer
Answer.text: The first description is correct she was always aware of her surroundings when she walked down the street and cautious about every possible wolf that crossed her path. I think the word cautiously in this description matches the word carefully in the event.

Answer.name: ClickInstruction
Answer.text: _user_, please click the correct orange character description below.

Question.text: _user_, how does this event connect to the plot?

Answer.name: CCCristina
Answer.text: The correct answer is that Rose trusted Agnes because of her appearance. Even though Rose pauses to consider the risk which seems in character, Rose allows Agnes to join her which seems out of character. This implies that Rose trusts Agnes.

Answer.name: ExplanationJordan
Answer.text: The other choices don't seem relevant to the highlighted event. When Rose considers the risk involved in talking to Agnes, it has nothing to do with how Agnes feels about Rose or Joseph taking any action.

Answer.name: HintCristina
Answer.text: _user_, when Rose pauses to consider the risk, what does she allow to happen?

Answer.name: HintJordan
Answer.text: _user_, think about the reasons Why Rose did not talk to strangers?

Answer.name: JordanAnswerIncor
Answer.text: I will choose the last one. Rose let Joseph get away with her wallet.

Answer.name: JordanAnswerCor
Answer.text: I will choose Rose trusted Agnes because of her appearance. Because if Rose didn't trust Agnes, she wouldn't talk to her.

Answer.name: ClickInstruction
Answer.text: _user_, please click the correct answer among four choices.

Question.text: _user_, is this sentence a character description or an event?

Answer.name: CCCristina
Answer.text: Action verbs are good clues for events. This event is crucial to the plot, because Rose realizes that the person she trusted has stolen her wallet.

Answer.name: ExplanationJordan
Answer.text: In the highlighted sentence, Rose looks back and doesn't see her wallet or Agnes. This is an action that occurs in the story, so it is an event.

Answer.name: HintCristina
Answer.text: _user_, events usually refer to an action that occurs in this story. Description refers to a static description.

Answer.name: HintJordan
Answer.text: _user_, does anything happen to Rose in this sentence?

Answer.name: JordanAnswerIncor
Answer.text: I think it is a character description.

Answer.name: JordanAnswerCor
Answer.text: The correct answer is event. Because Rose looks back to see that her wallet is stolen and Agnes is gone!

Answer.name: ClickInstruction
Answer.text: _user_, drag and drop the description or event icon on the highlighted sentence.

Question.text: _user_, how does this event connect to the plot?

Answer.name: CCCristina
Answer.text: The correct answer is Rose was distracted and Agnes got away, because Rose looked at Agnes and decided that she must not be the pickpocket based on her appearance.

Answer.name: ExplanationJordan
Answer.text: So Rose relaxed around Agnes and this allowed Agnes to steal Roses wallet and get away.

Answer.name: HintCristina
Answer.text: _user_, based on the highlighted event, what happens to Rose?

Answer.name: HintJordan
Answer.text: _user_, how does this event help us understand what happens in the story?

Answer.name: JordanAnswerIncor
Answer.text: The correct one should be the second one. Rose now knows who the thief is.

Answer.name: JordanAnswerCor
Answer.text: I think the correct one should be the third option, Rose was distracted and Agnes got away.
